questions.question: According to the author, what are the limitations of defining horror by its focus on monsters?

choices.answer: Some horror stories do not have a monster at all
A People can think of many different kinds of monsters.
Our ideas about vampires have changed over time.
The struggle between good and evil is more important

questions.question: The feeling of suspense in a horror story intensifies when ____________

choices.answer: The story takes place in a cheerful setting
The reader expects horrible events to occur
The characters avoid going into places like basements
The monsters in the story are unfamiliar to the reader

questions.question: What is an example of horror that has its source inside a character?

choices.answer: A woman knows she should not go into a basement but goes anyway.
A vampire in a story inspires a reader to hang garlic on her windows.
The squirrels in an attic cause people to think they hear ghosts.
A scientist desires knowledge so intensely that he creates a monster.
